Package marsRoverChallenge

Class Rover

  • java.lang.Object
    • marsRoverChallenge.Rover
  • public class Rover
extends java.lang.Object
    A class containing the methods that are needed to create an instance of the Rover object.
    Author:
    James Cotcher

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rover

        public Rover​(marsRoverChallenge.Plateau plateau)
        Constructor method for creating the rover
        Parameters:
        plateau - - an instance of the Plateau object that the rover will be 'navigating'

    • Method Detail

      • turnLeft

        public void turnLeft()
        turnLeft will turn the rover left 90 degrees from it's current orientation

      • turnRight

        public void turnRight()
        turnRight will turn the rover right 90 degrees from it's current orientation

      • move

        public void move()
        move will move the rover one square forward depending on it's orientation. If the rover is going to go off the side of the plateau, then the rover will not move, and the system will print which side of the plateau you are hitting.

      • interpretInstructions

        public void interpretInstructions​(java.lang.String instructions)
        interpretInstructions will interpret each character in a string of instructions, and perform those actions. The string can contain any number of 'L''R' and 'M'.
        Parameters:
        instructions - - the user input instructions that are to be interpreted

      • locationToString

        public java.lang.String locationToString()
        locationToString will return the current position and orientation of the rover
        Returns:
        The current position and orientation of the Rover.

      • getLeftCoordinate

        public int getLeftCoordinate()
        getLeftCoordinate will get the left coordinate of the Rover's position
        Returns:
        leftCoordinate the left coordinate of the rover's position

      • setLeftCoordinate

        public void setLeftCoordinate​(int leftCoordinate)
        setLeftCoordinate will set the left coordinate of the Rover's position
        Parameters:
        leftCoordinate - an integer representing the desired left-coordinate of the Rover

      • getRightCoordinate

        public int getRightCoordinate()
        getRightCoordinate will get the right coordinate of the Rover's position
        Returns:
        rightCoordinate the right coordinate of the rover's position

      • setRightCoordinate

        public void setRightCoordinate​(int rightCoordinate)
        setRightCoordinate will set the right coordinate of the Rover's position
        Parameters:
        rightCoordinate - an integer representing the desired right-coordinate of the Rover

      • getDirectionFacing

        public java.lang.String getDirectionFacing()
        getdirectionFacing will get the direction that the Rover is facing
        Returns:
        directionFacing is a one-character String of either "N", "E", "S" or "W".

      • setDirectionFacing

        public void setDirectionFacing​(java.lang.String directionFacing)
        setdirectionFacing will set the direction that the Rover is facing
        Parameters:
        directionFacing - is a one-character String of either "N", "E", "S" or "W".
